name: Carbamazepine

dosing.adult_acute: 200 mg BID, increase by 200 mg/day every 3-7 days
dosing.adult_maintenance: 600-1200 mg/day divided BID-QID; target level 4-12 mcg/mL
dosing.notes: Autoinduction occurs (metabolism increases over 3-5 weeks); monitor levels; extended-release formulations allow BID dosing

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 200 mg/day every 3-7 days based on response and levels
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Start 200 mg BID; increase by 200 mg every 3-5 days; monitor levels weekly initially
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Start 100-200 mg BID; slow titration; check levels after 2-4 weeks (post-autoinduction)

warnings: Black box warnings: (1) Serious dermatologic reactions (SJS, TEN) - higher risk in HLA-B*1502 carriers (Asian ancestry); (2) Aplastic anemia and agranulocytosis (rare)
HLA-B*1502 screening recommended before starting in patients of Asian ancestry
Autoinduction: Metabolism increases over 3-5 weeks - may need dose increases
Multiple drug interactions: Strong CYP3A4 inducer - reduces levels of oral contraceptives, many psychotropics
CBC monitoring: Baseline, then periodically (leukopenia, thrombocytopenia)
Teratogenic: Neural tube defects - avoid in pregnancy if possible

cautions.renal: Use with caution; dose adjustment may be needed
cautions.hepatic: Contraindicated in severe hepatic impairment; monitor LFTs
cautions.pregnancy: Pregnancy Category D - teratogenic; folic acid supplementation if used
